title: La Oruga Olga y el Borde de Fuego

content.translation: Olga the caterpillar lived on a large green leaf. She was long and green, like a small piece of sticky tape moving very slowly. Olga loved her leaf, but she was a very worried caterpillar.
content.text: La oruga Olga vivía en una gran hoja verde. Era larga y verde, como una pequeña cinta adhesiva que se movía muy despacio. Olga amaba su hoja, pero era una oruga muy preocupada.

content.translation: One evening, Olga saw something new. The sky turned orange and red. A bright, burning line appeared far away. 'Oh no!' she cried. 'The world is on fire! And that is the edge! We are going to fall off the edge of the world!'
content.text: Una tarde, Olga vio algo nuevo. El cielo se puso naranja y rojo. Una línea brillante y ardiente apareció a lo lejos. '¡Oh, no!', gritó ella. '¡El mundo está en llamas! ¡Y ese es el borde! ¡Vamos a caer por el borde del mundo!'

content.alt: Una oruga verde mira asustada un atardecer rojo y naranja desde su hoja.
content.prompt: A cute green caterpillar with huge, worried eyes, standing on a vibrant green leaf. In the background, a dramatic sunset fills the sky with brilliant shades of orange, red, and purple. The style is a whimsical, soft-textured children's book illustration. The caterpillar looks terrified of the beautiful sky. No text in the image.

content.translation: Olga had an idea. 'I must save my friends! We need to find the biggest, strongest leaf. We will all squeeze together on the leaf and float to safety!' So, she began her urgent mission.
content.text: Olga tuvo una idea. '¡Debo salvar a mis amigos! Necesitamos encontrar la hoja más grande y fuerte. ¡Nos vamos a apretar todos juntos en la hoja y flotar a un lugar seguro!' Así que empezó su misión urgente.

content.translation: First, she found Gregorio the Cricket. 'Gregorio, come quickly!' said Olga. 'The world is on fire at the edge! We must squeeze together on a safe leaf!' Gregorio looked at the sky and felt scared. 'You are right, Olga! Let's go!'
content.text: Primero, encontró al Grillo Gregorio. '¡Gregorio, ven rápido!', dijo Olga. '¡El mundo está en llamas en el borde! ¡Debemos apretarnos en una hoja segura!' Gregorio miró el cielo y sintió miedo. '¡Tienes razón, Olga! ¡Vamos!'

content.alt: La oruga Olga habla con urgencia a un grillo preocupado.
content.prompt: Children's book illustration in a friendly, cartoon style. Olga the green caterpillar is on a twig, speaking urgently to Gregorio, a cricket who is wiping his brow with a look of concern. The background is a soft-focus garden with the warm colors of sunset. No text.

content.translation: Then, they found Mari the Ladybug polishing her red shell. 'Mari, stop polishing!' shouted Olga. 'The world is on fire at the edge! We must squeeze together on a safe leaf!' Mari saw the red sky and gasped. 'Oh dear! Let's hurry!'
content.text: Luego, encontraron a la Mariquita Mari puliendo su caparazón rojo. '¡Mari, deja de pulir!', gritó Olga. '¡El mundo está en llamas en el borde! ¡Debemos apretarnos en una hoja segura!' Mari vio el cielo rojo y se asustó. '¡Ay, qué horror! ¡Vamos rápido!'

content.alt: La oruga, el grillo y una mariquita corren juntos por una rama, asustados.
content.prompt: A whimsical children's book illustration depicting a funny scene. Olga the caterpillar leads the way, followed closely by Gregorio the cricket and Mari the ladybug, who is flying just above them. All three have comically frightened expressions as they rush along a tree branch against a sunset sky. Soft, warm lighting. No text.

content.translation: Next, they met Carlos the Snail, moving very, very slowly. 'Carlos, hurry!' said Gregorio the cricket. 'The world is on fire at the edge! We must squeeze together on a safe leaf!' Carlos looked up, saw the orange sky, and tried to move faster. 'Wait... for... me!' he said.
content.text: Después, encontraron al Caracol Carlos, que se movía muy, muy despacio. '¡Carlos, date prisa!', dijo el grillo Gregorio. '¡El mundo está en llamas en el borde! ¡Debemos apretarnos en una hoja segura!' Carlos levantó la vista, vio el cielo naranja e intentó moverse más rápido. '¡Esperad... me!', dijo.

content.alt: Un grupo de insectos asustados se apiñan juntos: una oruga, un grillo, una mariquita y un caracol.
content.prompt: A heartwarming and slightly humorous illustration. Olga the caterpillar, Gregorio the cricket, Mari the ladybug, and Carlos the snail are all huddled together in a tight, scared group on the ground. They are looking in the same direction with wide, fearful eyes. The style is cute, with soft edges and a storybook feel. No text in the image.

content.translation: The frightened group arrived at the pond. On a large lily pad sat a big, calm frog. He wore a small leaf on his head like a hat. He was the captain of the pond. 'Hello, little ones,' he said in a deep voice. 'Why are you in such a hurry?'
content.text: El grupo asustado llegó al estanque. En un gran nenúfar estaba sentada una rana grande y tranquila. Llevaba una pequeña hoja en la cabeza como un sombrero. Era el capitán del estanque. 'Hola, pequeños', dijo con voz profunda. '¿Por qué tenéis tanta prisa?'

content.translation: 'Captain!' cried Olga. 'The world is on fire! Look at the burning edge! We need to squeeze onto a lily pad to escape!' The frog captain looked at the sky, and then at the worried little faces. He smiled kindly.
content.text: '¡Capitán!', gritó Olga. '¡El mundo está en llamas! ¡Mire el borde ardiente! ¡Necesitamos apretarnos en un nenúfar para escapar!' El capitán rana miró el cielo y luego las caritas preocupadas. Sonrió amablemente.

content.alt: Una rana sabia con un sombrero de hoja habla con calma al grupo de insectos asustados junto a un estanque.
content.prompt: A beautiful storybook scene. A wise, friendly green frog wearing a tiny leaf as a captain's hat sits calmly on a lily pad in a pond. He is gesturing kindly towards Olga the caterpillar, a cricket, a ladybug, and a snail, who are gathered at the water's edge looking up at him. The pond reflects the gorgeous colors of the sunset. The mood is calm and reassuring. Watercolor style. No text.

content.translation: 'That is not fire, little caterpillar,' said the captain. 'And it is not the edge of the world. That is the sunset. The sun is going to sleep, and it paints the sky with beautiful colors. It happens every evening. It is not dangerous, it is beautiful.' Olga and her friends looked at the sky. They saw the colors, not the fire. They were not scared anymore. They sat with the captain and watched the beautiful sunset.
content.text: 'Eso no es fuego, pequeña oruga', dijo el capitán. 'Y no es el borde del mundo. Es el atardecer. El sol se va a dormir y pinta el cielo con colores preciosos. Ocurre todas las tardes. No es peligroso, es hermoso'. Olga y sus amigos miraron al cielo. Vieron los colores, no el fuego. Ya no tenían miedo. Se sentaron con el capitán y observaron el hermoso atardecer.

moral.translation: Sometimes, the things that scare us the most are just things we don't understand.
moral.text: A veces, las cosas que nos dan más miedo son solo cosas que no entendemos.
